variant.question: Which word shall be used to ask a station whether you have correctly received a message, clearance, instruction, etc.?

options.text: Acknowledge.
Confirm.
Verify.
Correct.

variant.question: How shall a pilot inform a radar control unit that the aircraft is not equipped with transponder?

options.text: Transponder not available.
Negative squawk.
Negative transponder.
No SSR.

variant.question: RADAR instructs aircraft XYABC: "XBC reset squawk 1015". What does this mean:

options.text: XBC is requested to reselect SSR code 1015
XBC is requested to press IDENT
XBC has been identified by SSR code 1015
XBC has been identified at 10:15 (UTC)

variant.question: You are maintaining a track of 060° direct towards your destination. After establishing communication with an ATC radar unit, the controller instructs you: "FOR IDENTIFICATION TURN RIGHT HEADING ONE FIVE ZERO DEGREES." What should you do?

options.text: Turn 150° right onto a heading of 210° magnetic and maintain your current transponder setting.
Turn right onto 150° magnetic and select IDENT on your transponder.
Turn right onto 150° magnetic and maintain your current transponder setting.
Select IDENT on your transponder and maintain your present track. The SSR will provide the identification.

variant.question: Radar controllers can give traffic information. Which of the following transmissions is likely to require the pilot to alter heading in the near future? (F-BVZG, TRAFFIC..)

options.text: ONE O’CLOCK, THREE MILES, CROSSING LEFT TO RIGHT, SAME LEVEL.
TWO O’CLOCK, SIX MILES, SAME DIRECTION, 500 FEET ABOVE, CLIMBING.
TWELVE O\`CLOCK, FIVE MILES, OPPOSITE DIRECTION, SAME LEVEL.
ELEVEN O’CLOCK, SIX MILES, CLOSING, 500 FEET BELOW DESCENDING.

variant.question: You are making a radar approach to join the ILS, and wish to be vectored to a position on the localiser 8 miles from the threshold. What should you ask the radar controller? G-ACZG, REQUEST..

options.text: VECTORS 8 MILES.
STRAIGHT IN APPROACH FROM 8 MILES.
VECTORS TO INTERCEPT LOCALISER AT 8 MILES.
8 MILE FINAL.

variant.question: The radar controller transmits the following traffic information to you:”FOXTROT ALPHA GOLF DELTA ZULU, TRAFFIC TWO O’CLOCK EIGHT MILES, CLOSING,SAME LEVEL.” What would be an appropriate reply?

options.text: "FOXTROT APLHA GOLF DELTA ZULU, REPORT HEADING."
"ACKNOWLEDGED, WE ARE LOOKING, FOXTROT APLHA GOLF DELTA ZULU."
"FOXTROT ALPHA GOLF DELTA ZULU, NEGATIVE CONTACT, REQUEST VECTORS."
"FOXTROT ALPHA GOLF DELTA ZULU, REQUEST LEAVE HEADING."

variant.question: An aircraft is approaching Alicante airport and wishes to carry out an RNAV approach to runway 28 via the initial approach fix, VILNA. The correct phraseology for the request is:

options.text: Alicante approach, Globe Air 213 we request an RNAV approach via the initial approach fix to runway 28.
Globe Air 213, request RNAV approach via VILNA, runway 28.
Globe Air 213 request RNAV approach clearance to runway 28.
Alicante approach, Globe air 213 request approach clearance to carry out an RNAV approach to runway 28.

variant.question: What phrase should a pilot use to acknowledge that they have received ATIS Information Golf?

options.text: We have the ATIS Golf.
We have the information.
Weather Golf received.
Information Golf.

variant.question: ATC instructs the pilot: “GOLF ALPHA CHARLIE BRAVO ROMEO TRANSMIT FOR IDENTIFICATION AND REPORT HEADING”. The pilot should…

options.text:
| Transmit “GOLF ALPHA CHARLIE BRAVO ROMEO, TRANSMITTING FOR IDENTIFICATION PURPOSES, HEADING \[…\]” |  |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |  |

| Set the transponder to STBY and transmit “GOLF ALPHA CHARLIE BRAVO ROMEO HEADING \[…\]” |  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |  |

variant.question: An aircraft requires radar vectors to establish on the localiser at 8 NM. What is the appropriate transmission to ATC?

options.text: "GABCD request 8 NM final"
"GABCD request vectors 8 NM final"
"GABCD request straight in approach"
"GABCD request vectors for 8 NM final for the localiser”

variant.question: During radar vectoring, the controller asks the pilot of XY-ABC to turn on to heading 360°. What is the correct read back of this instruction?

options.text: Heading north, X-BC.
Heading three six zero, X-BC.
A read back is not necessary as XY-ABC has been identified.
Heading three hundred sixty, X-BC.

variant.question: For radar identification purposes, the controller is requesting to fly left, heading 240°. What is the correct readback?

options.text: Heading two four zero, CALL SIGN.
Heading two fourty degrees, CALL SIGN.
Left heading two four zero (degrees), CALL SIGN.
Left heading two four zero degrees to identify, CALL SIGN.

variant.question: For an aircraft which is over 136 000 kg, what word should be included in the initial radiotelephony contact?

options.text: "Heavy" before your callsign.
"Super" after your callsign.
Nothing, use the normal callsign only.
"Heavy" after your callsign.

variant.question: Which phrase will be used by a ground station to say that an aircraft has to set its SSR transponder to standby?

options.text: SSR transponder standby please
Squawk standby
Xponder standby
SSR standby

variant.question: ATC instructs an aircraft to perform a 360° turn to the right due to some slower traffic proceeding ahead. The correct sequence of the corresponding radio calls is:

options.text: F-AX, turn right complete turn. Turn right complete turn, F-AX
F-AX, turn thirty six zero right. Turn thirty six zero right, F-AX
F-AX, rotate to the right now. Rotate to the right now, F-AX
F-AX, make a three sixty turn right. Three sixty right, F-AX

variant.question: Which of the following communications contains the standard indication that radar vectoring is completed?

options.text: Set heading to LESDO.
Clear of traffic, direct LESDO.
Radar failure, proceed LESDO.
Resume own navigation to LESDO.

variant.question: What is the correct phraseology to determine the capability of the SSR equipment of an aircraft?

options.text: Advise Transponder Capability.
Advice SSR.
Report SSR Capability.
Report Transponder Capability.

variant.question: While under Flight Information Service, you wish to use your single radio to request an ATC clearance from another ground station. What phraseology should you use?

options.text: G-ACZG, request monitor ONE TWO FIVE DECIMAL SEVEN SEVEN FIVE.
G-ACZG, changing to ONE TWO FIVE POINT SEVEN SEVEN FIVE.
G-ACZG, request change to ONE TWO FIVE DECIMAL SEVEN SEVEN FIVE.
G-ACZG, request contact ONE TWO FIVE POINT SEVEN SEVEN FIVE.

variant.question:
FLUGPROP 546 is receiving their departure clearance which requires the use of GNSS, which the crew cannot accept. What is the correct response to the clearance "Cleared via ODEMI SIX VICTOR departure, squawk 1046"?   
_(callsigns are omitted)_

options.text: Unable RNAV.
Unable ODEMI SIX VICTOR due RNAV type.
Negative ODEMI SIX VICTOR due RNAV type, squawk 1046.
Negative RNAV, squawk 1046.

variant.question: What is the meaning of the phrase "Radar service terminated"?

options.text: ATC wants you to continue VFR.
You will no longer be provided with radar control.
ATC wants you to reset transponder.
You are now leaving the Terminal Area.

variant.question: Fastair 345 has been instructed to contact Stephenville ARRIVAL on frequency 118.0.How should the aircraft indicate that it will follow this instruction?

options.text: Changing to ARRIVAL Fastair 345.
Changing over Fastair 345.
Stephenville ARRIVAL Fastair 345.
118.0 Fastair 345.

variant.question:
In contact with a radar Air Traffic Services unit, an aircraft receives the three following messages (call signs are omitted).Which option lists correct responses to all of these messages?

1\. "Advise type of transponder capability"   
2\. "Check altimeter setting and confirmlevel"   
3\. "Turn left immediately heading 050 to avoid traffic 12 o’clock 3 miles"

options.text: 1\. Transponder Sierra 2\. Altimeter 1008 altitude 2000ft 3\. Left heading 050
1\. Transponder Bravo 2\. Altimeter 1008 altitude 2000ft 3\. Left immediately heading 050
1\. Transponder Alpha 2\. Altimeter 1008 flight level 110 3\. Left immediately 050
1\. Transponder Charlie 2\. Altimeter 1008 flight level 110 3\. Left immediately 050

variant.question: Two aircraft with similar registrations are flying in the same airspace, EC-ITY and ES-LTY. To avoid mistakes when sharing the same radio frequency:

options.text: ATC will abbreviate your callsign.
ATC will abbreviate the call sign on its own discretion.
ATC will not abbreviate the call signs in order to avoid mistakes.
It is not possible to abbreviate those call signs.

variant.question: What is the correct phraseology for a temporary suspension of transponder operation?

options.text: XPDR off
XPDR standby
Squawk standby
Squawk ident

variant.question: After achieving two-way communication, Mudfield Radar gives the following instruction: "GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF, TRANSMIT FOR IDENTIFICATION AND REPORT HEADING". The pilot should:

options.text: Select IDENT on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Transmit the following message: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Reselect Mode S on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Select SBY on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”

variant.question: During a radar approach, you are following an ATC instruction and have started a right turn from 210 degrees onto North. What instruction would you expect the controller to give you, if the controller now wants you to head 335 degrees instead?

options.text: G-ACZG, MODIFY HEADING THREE THREE FIVE DEGREES.
G-ACZG, LEAVE THREE SIX ZERO DEGREES HEADING THREE THREE FIVE DEGREES.
G-ACZG, FOLLOW HEADING THREE THREE FIVE DEGREES.
G-ACZG, STOP TURN HEADING THREE THREE FIVE DEGREES.

variant.question: The crew of a flight operated under the callsign Gulfstream HTK is cleared for departure via RNAV departure route PONTI4G. Due to degraded equipment functions, the aircraft does not meet the navigational accuracy for this specific RNAV procedure. The correct phrase to advise ATC of that issue would be:

options.text: Gulfstream HTK NEGATIVE RNAV
Gulfstream HTK UNABLE RNAV DUE EQUIPMENT
Gulfstream HTK NEGATIVE PONTI4G DEPARTURE DUE EQUIPMENT
Gulfstream HTK UNABLE PONTI4G DEPARTURE DUE RNAV TYPE
